skill.description: Use when receiving feature requests, architectural discussions, or multi-step implementation needs that require design before coding.
skill.summary: Structured workflow for designing, planning, and implementing features with the bpsai-pair CLI.
skill.author: BPSAI

content.user_title: Design, Plan, and Implement Features Systematically
content.value_statement: Many developers struggle with ad-hoc feature implementation that leads to technical debt and rework. This skill provides a structured workflow to clarify requirements, create plans, and track implementation tasks using the bpsai-pair CLI tool.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through a structured design-plan-implement workflow for features and refactors
Provide CLI commands for creating plans, tasks, and syncing with Trello
Recommend when to use planning versus direct implementation
Structure tasks with YAML format including priorities, complexity, and acceptance criteria
Organize project state in .paircoder directory structure
limitations: Requires the bpsai-pair CLI tool to be installed and configured
Only provides workflow guidance, does not execute commands automatically

use_cases.title: Feature Planning
use_cases.description: Software developers can use this skill to break down complex feature requests into manageable tasks with clear acceptance criteria before writing code.

use_cases.title: Architectural Refactoring
use_cases.description: Engineering teams can evaluate multiple approaches with pros and cons before committing to large-scale refactoring efforts.

use_cases.title: Project Task Tracking
use_cases.description: Project managers can create structured task lists with priorities and dependencies that sync to Trello boards.

prompt_templates.title: Check If Planning Is Needed
prompt_templates.prompt: Should I create a plan for implementing user authentication with OAuth?
prompt_templates.scenario: Determine whether a feature request requires formal planning

prompt_templates.title: Create Feature Plan
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a plan for adding real-time notifications to the dashboard, including tasks for WebSocket setup, UI components, and notification state management.
prompt_templates.scenario: Start a new feature with multiple components

prompt_templates.title: Propose Implementation Approaches
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to add caching to our API. Present 2-3 options with pros and cons: in-memory, Redis, and file-based caching.
prompt_templates.scenario: Evaluate different technical approaches before implementation

prompt_templates.title: Sync Plan to Trello
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to sync my authentication-feature plan to the Trello board under the Ready column.
prompt_templates.scenario: Integrate task planning with external project management tools

output_examples.input: Should I create a plan for fixing a typo in the README?
output_examples.output: No planning needed. Simple documentation fixes can be implemented directly without the design-plan-implement workflow.

output_examples.input: Create a plan for adding payment processing to the e-commerce site.
output: Creating plan for payment processing feature...
Command: bpsai-pair plan new payment-integration --type feature --title "Add Payment Processing"
- TASK-001: Research and select payment provider (Stripe vs PayPal)
- TASK-002: Set up payment provider SDK and API keys
- TASK-003: Implement checkout flow UI components
- TASK-004: Add server-side payment webhook handlers
- TASK-005: Write integration tests for payment flows
Each task should include acceptance criteria and P0/P1 priority levels.

output_examples.input: What files does this workflow create?
output_examples.output: The workflow creates plans in .paircoder/plans/ and tasks in .paircoder/tasks/. Each task is a YAML file with metadata including status, priority, complexity, and acceptance criteria.

best_practices: Always check if planning is needed before starting work to avoid over-engineering simple fixes
Include acceptance criteria with checkboxes in every task to define clear completion standards
Set realistic priority levels (P0 for must-have, P1 for should-have, P2 for nice-to-have) to focus efforts
anti_patterns: Creating detailed plans for trivial changes like typo fixes or small documentation updates
Skipping the clarification step and making assumptions about ambiguous requirements
Setting all tasks to P0 priority, which defeats the purpose of prioritization

faq.question: When should I use this workflow versus implementing directly?
faq.answer: Use this workflow for features, refactors, and multi-step work that affects multiple components. Skip planning for typo fixes, small bugs, and simple documentation changes.

faq.question: Do I need Trello to use this skill?
faq.answer: No, Trello integration is optional. The core workflow works with local YAML files in the .paircoder directory. Trello sync is an additional feature for teams already using that tool.

faq.question: What is the bpsai-pair CLI tool?
faq.answer: It is a command-line tool for managing development workflows, plans, and tasks. This skill provides guidance on using that tool effectively for structured feature implementation.

faq.question: How do I set task complexity values?
faq.answer: Use a 10-100 scale where 10 represents simple tasks taking less than an hour, and 100 represents complex work requiring multiple days. This helps with estimation and workload balancing.

faq.question: Can I modify the workflow steps?
faq.answer: Yes, the workflow is a guideline. You can adapt the steps based on your team's processes, but the core design-plan-implement sequence helps reduce technical debt and rework.

faq.question: Does this skill execute commands automatically?
faq.answer: No, this skill provides documentation and guidance. You need to run the bpsai-pair CLI commands manually based on the workflow recommendations.
